comments.body:
üìù Walkthrough ## Walkthrough This PR removes unused import mappings from build configuration and associated resolution scripts, adds a localization key for an About button, introduces a translation fallback mechanism, and updates the Layout component signature while bumping asset versions and refining internationalization support. ## Changes |Cohort / File(s)|Summary| |---|---| |**Build Configuration Cleanup**
`deno.json`|Removed import mappings for `@picocss/pico`, alpinejs, htmx.org, and std modules (`@std/fs`, `@std/path`), retaining only `@std/assert`.| |**Script & Test Removals**
`scripts/resolve_htmx.ts`, `scripts/update_static.ts`, `test_resolve.ts`|Deleted scripts for htmx resolution and static asset management; removed resolution test utilities.| |**Localization Enhancements**
`utils/i18n.ts`, `views/Calculator.tsx`|Added English translation for "aboutBtn" key; implemented fallback to English dictionary when translation key is missing in current language.| |**Layout Component Updates**
`views/Layout.tsx`|Modified function signature to require `title` and introduce optional `lang` parameter; updated HTML root lang attribute dynamically; bumped htmx to 2.0.8 and alpinejs to 3.15.8; standardized meta charset to lowercase; minor CSS whitespace adjustments.| ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 3 (Moderate) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~20 minutes ## Possibly related PRs - **syaryn/stock_back_calc#1**: Directly related as it appears to be the reverse of this PR‚Äîreverting the removed import mappings, scripts, and related changes. ## Poem > üê∞ Hoppy cleanup time, we've cleared the shelf, > Old scripts and imports say farewell, > Layout speaks English as a fallback friend, > Translations bloom, localization's trend, > Simpler configs, versions leap ahead!
üö• Pre-merge checks | ‚úÖ 3
‚úÖ Passed checks (3 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :----------------: | :------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Description Check | ‚úÖ Passed | Check skipped - CodeRabbit‚Äôs high-level summary is enabled. | | Title check | ‚úÖ Passed | The title accurately reflects the main changes: addressing PR feedback and cleaning up unused dependencies (removing htmx, alpinejs, pico imports and related scripts). | | Docstring Coverage | ‚úÖ Passed | No functions found in the changed files to evaluate docstring coverage. Skipping docstring coverage check. |
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can configure your own custom pre-merge checks in the settings.
‚ú® Finishing touches - [ ] üìù Generate docstrings
üß™ Generate unit tests (beta) - [ ] Create PR with unit tests - [ ] Post copyable unit tests in a comment - [ ] Commit unit tests in branch `fix/pr-feedback-cleanup`

reviews.body:
**Actionable comments posted: 2**

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents</summary>

```
In `@views/Layout.tsx`:
- Around line 54-73: The CSS selectors in Layout.tsx under the media queries are
malformed (written as `.responsive - grid`) which prevents matching the
`responsive-grid` class used by Calculator.tsx; update both selectors to
`.responsive-grid` and `.responsive-grid > *` (for the child rule) inside the
`@media (max-width: 768px)` and `@media (min-width: 769px)` blocks, and
normalize the indentation within those media query blocks so rules are nested
consistently.
- Around line 28-33: The external script URLs for htmx and Alpine in the Layout
component point to cdnjs versions that don't exist (htmx 2.0.8 and alpinejs
3.15.8); update the src values used in the script tags (the strings
"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/htmx/2.0.8/htmx.min.js" and
"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/alpinejs/3.15.8/cdn.min.js") to valid
CDN URLs‚Äîeither downgrade to the available cdnjs versions (htmx 2.0.7 and
alpinejs 3.15.0) or switch to the jsDelivr links provided
(https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/htmx.org@2.0.8/dist/htmx.min.js and
https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/alpinejs@3.15.8/dist/cdn.min.js) so the scripts
load reliably.
```

</details>

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment by CodeRabbit for review status -->
